channel.title: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
channel.description: Ok so this may be an odd question, so please bare with me. I am without internet for the majority of my time so playing on an online server is not something I can regularly do. I am wondering if there is a download or anything of that nature where I can play offline (that is beyond the default morparscape download.) I want to be able to play the game but as mentioned I seldom have access to the internet and do not have any skill in coding. Any ideas?

item.title: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
item.dc:creator: @Ykcud Ykcud
item.description:
@Ykcud wrote:

I do not even know where to begin to look for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Eyeownyew, post:7, topic:549158”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=668065.msg4469417#msg4469417 date=1422150274]
If you knew some basics about Java, then you could just remove multiplayer from player updating.
[/quote]
If he’s asking for this then he probably doesn’t, no need to be condescending[/quote]
I was giving some small advice. The least I would expect from him would be asking someone to do that for him.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
item.dc:creator: @Ykcud Ykcud
item.description:
@Ykcud wrote:

Thank you, but how do I run server a with a download from the above mentioned list. All my attempts have failed to run any program other than vanilla Morparscape, and even then I can not seem to log on via using the 127.0.0.1 local host.

When attempting to log on with my username and password I get the following error message "Error connecting to server. Must be down. Click ‘Cancel’ then ‘start server’ to make your own.

I then proceed to do so and attempt to log in after making my own server. “Your account is already logged in. Try again now, or make another name.”

All further attempts are met with the same error despite changing username and attempting sever times.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?

item.title: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Ykcud:

Is there a tutorial to run a sever on my own computer without access to the internet or would anyone be willing to walk me through it?

If the ip of the client is set to 127.0.0.1 you can play locally without internet.
127.0.0.1 is your localhost so if your server is also running there you can connect to it without internet.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a "single player" non defualt download?
